alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Ouachita (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 26 at 10:20AM CST until March 02 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Arkansas... Ouachita River At Camden affecting Calhoun and Ouachita Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Ouachita River At Camden. * WHEN...From this morning to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Low lying pastures and timber land along the river begins to flood. Sandy Beach Park at Camden starts to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CST Sunday the stage was 25.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.9 feet Monday evening. The river is then expected to fall to 24.5 feet early Wednesday afternoon. Given the rainfall in the forecast, additional rises are possible. - Action stage is 25.5 feet. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Crest Time Date Ouachita River Camden 26.0 25.1 Sun 9 AM 25.8 25.5 24.5 25.9 6 PM 2/27 &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
